@MrRajPop It was brilliantly done. The tour guide's enthusiasm shone through - fascinating insights plus great humour. (A few United jokes, of course!) Great to sit in Pep's chair and nose about the dressing room too..
@DeterminedDiner Wow, what stunning landscapes Lucy!

@stellamaris325 @BSBIbotany @sabpNHS @NHSEngland @butNHS @NHSMillion I think I'm particularly lucky where I work to have such incredible gardens. There's even a sculpture park too! And to think all this is public sector too..

Lavender, thistles, poppies and other wildflowers.. Is this Provence? Tuscany?.. No, it's the gardens of the #NHS mental health hospital I work in. Great to have such calming natural spaces for patients, families and staff. And SO important..
#wildflowerhour #wildflowers https://t.co/Shle74cEtR

For top Taiwanese food in town, this place is a Xu in..

Totally loved the #ManCity stadium tour. From the guide's engaging banter - fascinating stories laced with typical Mancunian humour - to a surprisingly moving video that had dad & me welling up with tears! (yes, grown men crying over football - 6/10 on the Gazza Scale!)
#football https://t.co/XFu09ptCzr
@girlnextshore I agree, food memories can be very poignant. And those spring rolls look beautiful btw - I'm sure they would have pleased your grandma!

I wrote this Trump protest piece when he got elected. Two years on, he's turned out just as most of us thought. I guess there hasn't been a nuclear apocalypse, but that's a pretty low baseline to judge a president.

From cradle to grave,
In grief and despair,

From med school 25yrs ago, now a doctor in a busy child mental health service, I've seen #NHS go thru such change and challenge. It can be a tough gig at times, but I'm so deeply proud to be part of it. Here's my love-letter to the NHS..
#NHS70 #OurNHS70

The restaurants on the lakefront at Orta have the most idyllic views, overlooking the tiny Isola San Giulio which sits in the centre of the lake. Legend has it the island is home to dragons. Well, as long as they don't come after my tagliatelle, that's all I care about!..🐉 https://t.co/wD0qmJotOY

@SavlaFaire @NigelSlater Yes, do so! And you can make it easily in bulk - in fact, why would anyone NOT make it in bulk! - which is great for when people come over too. Totally recommend the Nigel Slater recipe too - best I've come across..
@chiarapinto I think I'll try it for brekkie too one day - although with all that Marsala in it, perhaps not on a work day! 😂
@WWannualleave No probs at all, Shikha! Loved your account, including when you reflected back on previous family holidays to Rome. Yes, really enjoying the Italy trip. Don't want to come back!..
@juliadarwen @LakeOrta @regionepiemonte @Italia Wow, 15 years! I can totally see why though. It's just such a special spot. Surprisingly not over-developed at all. What's the Imbarcadero like?..

Zabaglione for breakfast? Apparently it's a done thing round here in Piedmont - certainly something to get up for on a Monday morning! This one was for dessert however - rich, velvety + full of booze. Another recipe from Claudia Roden's "Food of Italy".
🥚🥚🥚🍷
#MondayMotivation https://t.co/7tHU5g4AHk

When in Rome..
(get a local to take you round - it's a great way to get the lowdown on the city's sights and sounds..🏛️)
#travelblogger #Rome https://t.co/63TjPiU05E
@GabrielaLarios1 That's good news, Gabbie! x

So next up on my Italian cooking spree, an old classic - tiramisu. I prefer my tiramisus a bit sloppy and full of booze - which is a good job as this one scored high on both counts!
(recipe is my take on one by @NigelSlater)
🍷🥚🍫🍪☕
#italy #food #dessert https://t.co/YNJQ0GlfHF

@juliadarwen @LakeOrta @regionepiemonte @Italia This is our second year now on the run at Lake Orta - we loved it so much last year, and same again now. I'm sure we'll be back again soon! Just came back from a superb (and great value) lunch at 'Cucchiaio di Legno' agriturismo near Orta - have you been before?..
@kirankishore21 No, this is just a simple ricotta recipe. But the ricotta was just so delicious. No piggy here!
RT @juliadarwen: @1dish4theroad @LakeOrta @regionepiemonte @Italia Kendal’s market charter was granted in 1189 by Richard I. Still going to…

@juliadarwen @LakeOrta @regionepiemonte @Italia Love hearing about this bit of history, Julia! Markets can be such an important focal point for a town, its community and economy. (Question is - is there a mint cake stall?..)
@TheWatchfulCook just to say a big thanks once again for all your Turin tips! We got to a couple of them, and really enjoyed the city overall. Hope you've had a good weekend! x
@KarenLondoner Sorry to have missed the game. I'm sure Arsenal will come good - it's just gonna need a bit of time for the manager to get his style bedded down?..

@SigneSJohansen Thanks Signe! I'm trying to work my way through Claudia Roden's "Food of Italy" cookbook whilst I'm out here. So this was based on her 'spaghetti with ricotta and goat's cheese' recipe. Erm, but without the goat's cheese! 🐏
@LondonKiwiEmma He was just SO enthusiastic! And I was in my element too..

It was the trundling of the freight trains by the banks of Lake Orta that gave me the idea to write this piece last year - a travelogue thru the eyes of a shipping container. So happy to be back here once again..🇮🇹
#travelblogger #travel #ttot
https://t.co/0Z50hiFrz2

First up on my Italian cooking spree - 'spaghetti w. ricotta'. The #cheese came from the fabulous "Cusio Formaggi", whose owner was so enthusiastic that he'd not only talk about the cheese, but stepped us outside + started pointing at the various mountains where they came from 🧀 https://t.co/KDO00lWdJw
@NancyRothery1 You've got your own fig tree? That's amazing! I love figs (esp with yoghurt and honey..)

There's been a Wednesday market in Orta San Giulio for nearly 800 years. And it's still a great place to pick up some local cheeses, meats, and other produce.. 🧀🍅🍞
#market #italy @regionepiemonte https://t.co/RTqYvg4JuT

Olive hunting at Orta San Giulio's weekly market.. 🇮🇹

The dome of Turin's Chiesa San Lorenzo is not only visually stunning, but there is also mathematical symbolism aplenty, whilst the polygonal structure in the centre was inspired by Islamic art.. ⛪
#turin #church #architecture https://t.co/YrpkqVLgXQ

50 years before the 'Magnum', came the 'Pinguino' - Turin's frozen confectionary gift to the world. And it's a more grown-up version too - the shell's of proper dark chocolate, and the gelato flavours include gianduja, coffee and violet.. 😋🍦
#icecream #gelato #turin https://t.co/9m1cAoGX4R
